test_cases.Title: FirstLine_proj_001_display_first_line/Desktop_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Open the application on a desktop device.
Steps.Expected Result: The application launches successfully.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the main screen or section where the first line should be displayed.
Steps.Expected Result: The main screen loads without errors.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the first line is present and visible at the top of the designated area.
Steps.Expected Result: The first line is displayed clearly and is readable at the top of the section.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. The application is installed on the desktop device.
2. The user has access rights to open and view the application.
3. The application is not running in the background.
test_cases.Dataset: No specific data required; default application state.
test_cases.Expected Result: The first line is displayed at the top of the designated area on the main screen, clearly visible and readable.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers only the display of the first line on desktop devices.

test_cases.Title: FirstLine_proj_001_display_first_line/Desktop_NEGATIVE_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Open the application on a desktop device with a corrupted configuration file.
Steps.Expected Result: The application launches and handles the corrupted configuration gracefully.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the main screen or section where the first line should be displayed.
Steps.Expected Result: The main screen loads, or an appropriate error message is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the first line is not displayed or an error message is shown indicating the issue.
Steps.Expected Result: The application does not crash; it either displays an error message or omits the first line gracefully.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. The application is installed on the desktop device.
2. The configuration file is intentionally corrupted.
3. The user has access rights to open and view the application.
test_cases.Dataset: Corrupted configuration file.
test_cases.Expected Result: The application does not crash and handles the missing or corrupted first line gracefully, displaying an error message if appropriate.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers error handling for missing or corrupted first line data.

test_cases.Title: InitialLoad-ZENIT_001_RF001_InitialLoadAndDataMigration_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Ensure the system is in a clean state with no pre-existing data.
Steps.Expected Result: System is ready for initial data load.

Steps.Step Description: Initiate the initial data load and migration process via the provided interface or backend trigger.
Steps.Expected Result: Data migration process starts without errors.

Steps.Step Description: Monitor the migration process for completion.
Steps.Expected Result: Migration completes successfully with a confirmation message.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that all expected data entities (e.g., PoS, Credit Lines, Contracts) are present in the system post-migration.
Steps.Expected Result: All data entities are correctly loaded and accessible.

Steps.Step Description: Check for data integrity by comparing a sample of migrated records with the source system.
Steps.Expected Result: Sample records match exactly between source and destination.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. Access to a clean test environment.
2. Source data available and accessible.
3. Migration tools/interfaces configured.
4. User with permissions to execute migration.
test_cases.Dataset: Sample source data set for migration (e.g., PoS list, contracts, credit lines).
test_cases.Expected Result: System contains all migrated data, with integrity and completeness verified against the source.

test_cases.Title: SessionTimeout-ZENIT_002_RF002_DisconnectedForInactivity_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the ZENIT application as a valid user.
Steps.Expected Result: User is successfully logged in and dashboard is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Remain inactive (no mouse or keyboard input) for the configured inactivity timeout period (e.g., 15 minutes).
Steps.Expected Result: No user activity detected during the timeout period.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the system behavior after the timeout period elapses.
Steps.Expected Result: User is automatically logged out and redirected to the login page with a session timeout message.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. User account exists and is active.
2. Inactivity timeout configured in the system (e.g., 15 minutes).
3. User is logged in to the application.
test_cases.Dataset: Valid user credentials.
test_cases.Expected Result: User is automatically logged out after inactivity and receives a session timeout notification.

test_cases.Title: LoginTracking-ZENIT_003_RF003_LoginTrackingSOX_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the ZENIT application using valid credentials.
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated and login event is triggered.

Steps.Step Description: Access the audit/log tracking system or database.
Steps.Expected Result: Audit/log tracking system is accessible.

Steps.Step Description: Search for the login event corresponding to the user and timestamp.
Steps.Expected Result: Login event is recorded with correct user ID, timestamp, and relevant metadata (e.g., IP address, session ID).

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. User account exists and is active.
2. Audit/log tracking system is operational.
3. User is not currently logged in.
test_cases.Dataset: Valid user credentials.
test_cases.Expected Result: Login event is correctly recorded in the audit/log tracking system with all required details.

test_cases.Title: Concurrency-ZENIT_004_RF005_ManageConcurrency_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the ZENIT application as User A.
Steps.Expected Result: User A is logged in successfully.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to log in to the ZENIT application as User A from a different browser or device simultaneously.
Steps.Expected Result: System detects concurrent login attempt.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the system response to the second login attempt.
Steps.Expected Result: System either prevents the second login or logs out the first session, according to the defined concurrency policy.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. User account exists and is active.
2. Concurrency management is enabled in the system.
3. Two browsers/devices available for testing.
test_cases.Dataset: Valid user credentials for User A.
test_cases.Expected Result: System enforces concurrency policy, preventing simultaneous sessions for the same user as per requirements.

test_cases.Title: Settings-ZENIT_005_RF006_SettingsManagement_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the ZENIT application as a user with settings management permissions.
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated and settings menu is accessible.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the settings section of the application.
Steps.Expected Result: Settings page is displayed with configurable options.

Steps.Step Description: Modify a configurable setting (e.g., notification preferences, display options).
Steps.Expected Result: Setting is updated and saved successfully.

Steps.Step Description: Log out and log back in to verify the setting persists.
Steps.Expected Result: Modified setting remains in effect after re-login.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. User account with settings management permissions exists.
2. Application is accessible.
3. Settings functionality is enabled.
test_cases.Dataset: Valid user credentials; example setting to modify.
test_cases.Expected Result: User can modify and persist settings successfully.

test_cases.Title: Introduction-proj_001_documentation_translation_functional_specification/Desktop_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Obtain the user requirements document and the corresponding functional specification document.
Steps.Expected Result: Both documents are available for review.

Steps.Step Description: Compare the content of the user requirements document with the functional specification document section by section.
Steps.Expected Result: Each user requirement is mapped to a corresponding functional specification.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that all user requirements are accurately and completely translated into functional specifications.
Steps.Expected Result: No user requirement is missing or inaccurately represented in the functional specification.

Steps.Step Description: Check for consistency in terminology and structure between the two documents.
Steps.Expected Result: Terminology and structure are consistent, ensuring clarity and traceability.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. User requirements document is finalized and approved.
2. Functional specification document is available for review.
3. Access to both documents is granted.
test_cases.Dataset: Sample user requirements document and corresponding functional specification document.
test_cases.Expected Result: All user requirements are fully and accurately translated into functional specifications, with no omissions or inconsistencies.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers only the translation and mapping process, not the implementation of requirements.

test_cases.Title: Glossary-proj_001_abbreviation_display_desktop_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the glossary or abbreviation section of the application on a desktop device.
Steps.Expected Result: The glossary/abbreviation section loads successfully.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that all terms and their corresponding descriptions are displayed in a tabular or structured format.
Steps.Expected Result: Each term (e.g., ADI, ADM, AWP, etc.) and its description are visible and correctly aligned.

Steps.Step Description: Check that the formatting (e.g., bold for important terms, clear separation between term and description) is consistent across all entries.
Steps.Expected Result: Formatting is consistent and enhances readability for all glossary entries.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. User has access to the application on a desktop device.
2. User is logged in (if authentication is required).
3. Glossary/abbreviation section is available in the application menu.
test_cases.Dataset: N/A (static glossary data)
test_cases.Expected Result: All glossary terms and their descriptions are displayed clearly and accurately in a structured format.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers only the display and formatting of glossary terms, not editing or searching.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the glossary or abbreviation section of the application on a desktop device.

Steps.Step Description: Enter a term (e.g., 'AWP') into the search or filter field provided in the glossary section.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that only the relevant term(s) and their descriptions are displayed after the search/filter is applied.

test_cases.Expected Result: The glossary search/filter feature displays only the relevant term(s) and their descriptions based on the input.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers search/filter functionality, not display or editing.

test_cases.Title: CreditStatusVisibility-proj1_req1_CustomerCreditStatus_Backoffice_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the ZENIT back office application as a Finance team user.
Steps.Expected Result: User is successfully authenticated and redirected to the dashboard.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the 'Customer Credit Status' section from the main menu.
Steps.Expected Result: The 'Customer Credit Status' page is displayed, listing all retail customers.

Steps.Step Description: Select a specific retail customer from the list.
Steps.Expected Result: Detailed credit status for the selected customer is displayed, including credit limit, current exposure, and available credit.

Steps.Step Description: Drill down into a business area (e.g., select a specific product or channel).
Steps.Expected Result: Credit status details are filtered and displayed for the selected business area.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. ZENIT application is deployed and accessible.
2. Test user account with Finance team permissions is available.
3. At least one retail customer with credit data exists in the system.
test_cases.Dataset: Finance team user credentials; at least one retail customer with credit data.
test_cases.Expected Result: The user can view comprehensive and drill-down credit status information for any retail customer across all business areas.

test_cases.Title: RiskSummary-proj1_req2_CompanyRiskSummary_Backoffice_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the ZENIT back office application as a Finance team user.
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated and redirected to the dashboard.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the 'Risk Summary' section from the main menu.
Steps.Expected Result: The 'Risk Summary' page is displayed, showing an overview of the company's risk level.

Steps.Step Description: Review the risk indicators and summary metrics presented.
Steps.Expected Result: The risk summary displays aggregated risk metrics, including total exposure, risk by channel, and risk by product.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. ZENIT application is deployed and accessible.
2. Test user account with Finance team permissions is available.
3. Risk data is present in the system.
test_cases.Dataset: Finance team user credentials; risk data for company and channels.
test_cases.Expected Result: The user can view a summary of the company's risk level, including breakdowns by channel and product.

test_cases.Title: ChannelClassification-proj1_req3_ChannelCategoryAssignment_Backoffice_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the ZENIT back office application as an admin user.
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated and redirected to the dashboard.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the 'Points of Sale' management section.
Steps.Expected Result: The list of all points of sale is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Select a point of sale with 'Cluster PV' value set to 'PGI'.
Steps.Expected Result: Point of sale details are displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Verify the 'Canale 1' field value.
Steps.Expected Result: 'Canale 1' is set to 'BRANDED'.

Steps.Step Description: Repeat steps 3-4 for 'PGS', 'Negozio', and 'Wincity' (expect 'BRANDED'), and for 'Pos AWP Only', 'Pos GNTN e AWP', 'Pos GNTN Only', 'Gaming Hall' (expect 'UNBRANDED').
Steps.Expected Result: Each point of sale is correctly classified as 'BRANDED' or 'UNBRANDED' according to the mapping rules.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. ZENIT application is deployed and accessible.
2. Admin user account is available.
3. Points of sale with all relevant 'Cluster PV' values exist in the system.
test_cases.Dataset: Admin user credentials; points of sale with 'Cluster PV' values: PGI, PGS, Negozio, Wincity, Pos AWP Only, Pos GNTN e AWP, Pos GNTN Only, Gaming Hall.
test_cases.Expected Result: All points of sale are automatically and correctly assigned to the appropriate channel category ('BRANDED' or 'UNBRANDED') based on their 'Cluster PV' value.

test_cases.Title: CreditLineVisibility-proj1_req4_CreditLineProducts_Backoffice_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the ZENIT back office application as a Finance team user.
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated and redirected to the dashboard.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the 'Credit Lines' section.
Steps.Expected Result: The 'Credit Lines' page is displayed, listing all available credit lines/products.

Steps.Step Description: Select a point of sale from the list.
Steps.Expected Result: Credit line details for the selected point of sale are displayed, including all products (Totocalcio, Horse Racing, Fixed Odds Sports, Virtual Race, Global Game, Numerical Games, Corner, Game Accounts).

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. ZENIT application is deployed and accessible.
2. Finance team user account is available.
3. Credit line data for all products is present in the system.
test_cases.Dataset: Finance team user credentials; points of sale with credit line data for all products.
test_cases.Expected Result: The user can view all available credit lines/products for each point of sale, with correct product mapping and weekly management indication.

test_cases.Title: DashboardRealTime-proj1_req5_RealTimeDashboard_Backoffice_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the ZENIT back office application as a Credit team user.
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated and redirected to the dashboard.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the dashboard for real-time updates on credit status and risk metrics.
Steps.Expected Result: Dashboard displays up-to-date information without requiring manual refresh.

Steps.Step Description: Trigger a credit status change for a point of sale (e.g., simulate a transaction affecting credit exposure).
Steps.Expected Result: Dashboard updates in real time to reflect the new credit status and risk metrics.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. ZENIT application is deployed and accessible.
2. Credit team user account is available.
3. Real-time data integration is enabled.
4. Ability to simulate or trigger credit status changes.
test_cases.Dataset: Credit team user credentials; test point of sale for credit status simulation.
test_cases.Expected Result: The dashboard provides real-time, accurate updates on credit status and risk metrics for all points of sale.

test_cases.Title: MDMIntegration-proj_001_MDM_MasterDataSync_ZENIT_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Ensure MDM system contains up-to-date PoS master data for all countries.
Steps.Expected Result: MDM system is populated with valid PoS master data.

Steps.Step Description: Trigger synchronization of PoS master data from MDM to ZENIT via ESB.
Steps.Expected Result: Synchronization process is initiated and data is sent to ZENIT.

Steps.Step Description: Access ZENIT and navigate to the PoS master data management section.
Steps.Expected Result: ZENIT displays the latest PoS master data received from MDM.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that PoS master data in ZENIT matches the data in MDM for all countries.
Steps.Expected Result: PoS master data in ZENIT is consistent with MDM data.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. MDM system is operational and contains valid PoS master data.
2. ESB is configured and operational.
3. ZENIT is deployed and accessible.
4. User has access rights to view PoS master data in ZENIT.
test_cases.Dataset: Sample PoS master data in MDM for multiple countries.
test_cases.Expected Result: ZENIT successfully receives and displays PoS master data from MDM via ESB, matching the source data.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Does not cover error handling for failed synchronization.

Steps.Step Description: Continue this activity for a duration exceeding the inactivity timeout period (e.g., 20 minutes).
Steps.Expected Result: User remains logged in and is not logged out due to inactivity.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. User account exists and is active.
2. User is able to access the application on a desktop device.
3. Inactivity timeout is configured (e.g., 15 minutes).
test_cases.Dataset: Valid user credentials (e.g., user@example.com / Password123)
test_cases.Expected Result: User remains logged in as long as activity is detected within the timeout period.

test_cases.Title: InactivityLogout-proj_RF002_LogoutMessageContent_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Expected Result: User is successfully logged in and navigated to the main dashboard.

Steps.Step Description: Remain inactive for the configured inactivity timeout period.
Steps.Expected Result: No user activity is detected during the timeout period.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the message displayed after automatic logout due to inactivity.
Steps.Expected Result: A clear and informative message is displayed, indicating that the user was logged out due to inactivity.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. User account exists and is active.
2. User is able to access the application on a desktop device.
3. Inactivity timeout is configured (e.g., 15 minutes).
test_cases.Dataset: Valid user credentials (e.g., user@example.com / Password123)
test_cases.Expected Result: A clear message is shown to the user after logout, explaining the reason (inactivity).

test_cases.Title: InactivityLogout-proj_RF002_SessionResourceRelease_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the application using valid user credentials on a desktop device.
Steps.Expected Result: User is successfully logged in and navigated to the main dashboard.

Steps.Step Description: Remain inactive for the configured inactivity timeout period.
Steps.Expected Result: No user activity is detected during the timeout period.

Steps.Step Description: After automatic logout, attempt to perform an action that requires an active session (e.g., refresh the page or access a protected resource).
Steps.Expected Result: The system prevents access and prompts the user to log in again, confirming that the session has been terminated and resources released.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. User account exists and is active.
2. User is able to access the application on a desktop device.

test_cases.Dataset: Valid user credentials (e.g., user@example.com / Password123)
test_cases.Expected Result: After logout, session resources are released and protected actions require re-authentication.

test_cases.Title: LogTracking-proj_RF004_LogTraceability_SOXCompliance_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Access the log management system or retrieve the log file for the session.
Steps.Expected Result: The log entry for the login operation is present, complete, and unaltered.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the log entry contains all required SOX-compliant fields (timestamp, user ID, action, result, source IP, etc.).

test_cases.Title: ConcurrentUpdate-proj_RF005_ManageConcurrency_UpdateRecord_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: User A logs into the system and navigates to the shared data record.
Steps.Expected Result: User A successfully accesses the data record.

Steps.Step Description: User B logs into the system and navigates to the same shared data record.
Steps.Expected Result: User B successfully accesses the same data record.

Steps.Step Description: User A edits a field in the record and saves the changes.
Steps.Expected Result: User A's changes are saved successfully.

Steps.Step Description: User B, without refreshing, edits the same field in the record and attempts to save.
Steps.Expected Result: The system detects the concurrent modification and either prevents User B from saving, prompts for conflict resolution, or merges changes according to business rules.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. Both User A and User B have valid credentials and access rights.
2. The shared data record exists in the system.
3. The system is running and accessible to both users.
test_cases.Dataset: User A and User B credentials; shared data record ID.
test_cases.Expected Result: The system detects and manages concurrent updates, ensuring data consistency and preventing data loss.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers concurrent update scenario for a single data record.

test_cases.Title: ConcurrentReadWrite-proj_RF005_ManageConcurrency_ReadWhileWrite_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: User A logs into the system and navigates to a shared data record.
Steps.Expected Result: User A successfully accesses the data record.

Steps.Step Description: User B logs into the system and navigates to the same shared data record.
Steps.Expected Result: User B successfully accesses the same data record.

Steps.Step Description: User A begins editing the record but does not save yet.
Steps.Expected Result: User A is in edit mode for the record.

Steps.Step Description: User B attempts to read the record while User A is editing.
Steps.Expected Result: User B either sees a lock notification, a read-only version, or the last saved state, depending on system design.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. Both User A and User B have valid credentials and access rights.
2. The shared data record exists in the system.
3. The system is running and accessible to both users.
test_cases.Dataset: User A and User B credentials; shared data record ID.
test_cases.Expected Result: The system prevents data inconsistency by managing read/write access during concurrent operations.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers read access during concurrent write operation.

test_cases.Title: SimultaneousCreate-proj_RF005_ManageConcurrency_CreateRecord_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: User A and User B log into the system simultaneously.
Steps.Expected Result: Both users are authenticated and have access to the application.

Steps.Step Description: Both users attempt to create a new record with the same unique identifier at the same time.
Steps.Expected Result: The system processes both requests.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the system's response to both creation attempts.
Steps.Expected Result: The system allows only one record with the unique identifier to be created and notifies the other user of a conflict or duplicate entry.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. Both User A and User B have valid credentials and access rights.
2. The system is running and accessible to both users.
3. The unique identifier to be used for the new record does not already exist.
test_cases.Dataset: User A and User B credentials; unique identifier for new record.
test_cases.Expected Result: The system prevents duplicate records and maintains data integrity during simultaneous create operations.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers simultaneous creation of records with unique constraints.

test_cases.Title: ConcurrentDelete-proj_RF005_ManageConcurrency_DeleteWhileEdit_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: User A logs into the system and navigates to a shared data record.
Steps.Expected Result: User A successfully accesses the data record.

Steps.Step Description: User B logs into the system and navigates to the same shared data record.
Steps.Expected Result: User B successfully accesses the same data record.

Steps.Step Description: User A begins editing the record but does not save yet.
Steps.Expected Result: User A is in edit mode for the record.

Steps.Step Description: User B attempts to delete the record while User A is editing.
Steps.Expected Result: The system either prevents the deletion, prompts for conflict resolution, or handles the operation according to business rules (e.g., notifies User A, cancels edit, or allows deletion with warning).

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. Both User A and User B have valid credentials and access rights.
2. The shared data record exists in the system.
3. The system is running and accessible to both users.
test_cases.Dataset: User A and User B credentials; shared data record ID.
test_cases.Expected Result: The system manages concurrent delete and edit operations to ensure data consistency and prevent data loss.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers delete operation during concurrent edit.

test_cases.Title: ConcurrentBulkUpdate-proj_RF005_ManageConcurrency_BulkUpdate_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: User A logs into the system and selects multiple records for bulk update.
Steps.Expected Result: User A is able to select and initiate bulk update on multiple records.

Steps.Step Description: User B logs into the system and selects one or more of the same records for individual update.
Steps.Expected Result: User B is able to select and begin editing the records.

Steps.Step Description: User A performs and submits the bulk update.
Steps.Expected Result: Bulk update is processed by the system.

Steps.Step Description: User B attempts to save changes to a record that was included in the bulk update.
Steps.Expected Result: The system detects the concurrent modification and either prevents User B from saving, prompts for conflict resolution, or merges changes according to business rules.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. Both User A and User B have valid credentials and access rights.
2. Multiple shared data records exist in the system.
3. The system is running and accessible to both users.
test_cases.Dataset: User A and User B credentials; IDs of records for bulk update.
test_cases.Expected Result: The system manages concurrent bulk and individual updates to maintain data consistency.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers concurrent bulk and individual update scenarios.

test_cases.Title: Arxivar_001_RF007_DocumentList_AutomaticRetrieval_DESKTOP_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the 'Documents' section where Arxivar integration is available.

Steps.Step Description: Trigger the document acquisition process for the specific PoS (e.g., by clicking 'Retrieve Documents').

2. The Arxivar service is available and reachable from the test environment.
3. Predefined criteria for document type and status are configured in the system.
4. At least one document matching the criteria exists in Arxivar for the PoS.
test_cases.Dataset: User credentials, PoS identifier, sample documents in Arxivar with various types and statuses.
test_cases.Expected Result: The system connects to Arxivar and displays only the documents for the specific PoS that match the predefined type and status criteria.

test_cases.Title: InitialLoadDataMigration_proj001_requirement_DataImportValidation_DESKTOP_TEST_Desktop

test_cases.Title: InitialLoadDataMigration_proj001_requirement_ErrorHandlingOnCorruptData_DESKTOP_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Prepare a legacy data source containing intentionally corrupt or malformed records.

Steps.Expected Result: Migration process starts and processes available data.

Steps.Step Description: Monitor the migration process for error handling and logging.
Steps.Expected Result: Migration tool detects corrupt records and logs appropriate errors without halting the entire process.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that only valid records are migrated to the new system.
Steps.Expected Result: Only valid records are present in the new system; corrupt records are excluded.

3. Target system is available and empty.

test_cases.Expected Result: Migration process completes, valid records are migrated, and corrupt records are logged and excluded.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers error handling for corrupt data during migration.

test_cases.Title: InitialLoadDataMigration_proj001_requirement_PerformanceOfBulkMigration_DESKTOP_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Expected Result: System remains stable and migration progresses without critical failures.

Steps.Step Description: Record the end time when migration completes.

Steps.Step Description: Calculate total migration duration and compare against performance benchmarks (e.g., must complete within 2 hours).
Steps.Expected Result: Migration completes within the defined performance threshold.

4. User has necessary permissions to perform migration.

test_cases.Title: InitialLoadDataMigration_proj001_requirement_RollbackOnFailure_DESKTOP_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Prepare a legacy data set and configure the migration tool to simulate a failure during migration (e.g., network interruption, disk full).
Steps.Expected Result: Migration tool is set to simulate a failure scenario.

Steps.Step Description: Initiate the data migration process.
Steps.Expected Result: Migration process starts and proceeds until the simulated failure occurs.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the system's response to the failure.
Steps.Expected Result: Migration process halts and triggers rollback procedures.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the target system remains unchanged or is restored to its pre-migration state.
Steps.Expected Result: No partial or inconsistent data is present in the target system after rollback.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. Legacy data set is prepared and accessible.
2. Migration tool is installed and configured to simulate failure.
3. Target system is available and empty.
4. User has necessary permissions to perform migration.
test_cases.Dataset: Legacy data set; migration tool configured for failure simulation.
test_cases.Expected Result: On migration failure, the system performs a rollback, ensuring no partial or inconsistent data remains in the target system.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers rollback and data consistency on migration failure.

test_cases.Title: GEOCLines-XPS020_DataAcquisition_CalculatedFieldsValidation_DESKTOP_TEST_Desktop

test_cases.Title: WinningsMonitoring_XPS-ZENIT-110_DailyDataAcquisition_SportTicketsPaidOtherPoS_backend_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Ensure the DWH has generated the daily winnings monitoring report for sport tickets paid at other sales points, containing all required fields.
Steps.Expected Result: DWH report is available and contains data for sport tickets paid at other sales points.

Steps.Step Description: Trigger or wait for the Zenit system's daily data acquisition process to run at end of day.
Steps.Expected Result: Zenit system initiates data acquisition from DWH.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that Zenit acquires and aggregates data based on: Seller PoS identifier (ZonaRice), Sell date, Identifier of PoS where payment was made, and Payment date.
Steps.Expected Result: Data is aggregated correctly according to the specified keys.

Steps.Step Description: Check that the following fields are extracted and aggregated: Seller Agency Code, Seller PoS identifier, Competence Day, Cash day, Winning payment Day, Agency Code Payment, PoS Identifier of the payment, Amount bet, Amount Won.
Steps.Expected Result: All required fields are present and correctly formatted in the aggregated data.

Steps.Step Description: Validate that Seller Agency Code is a 6-character string left-padded with zeros, or for 'Corner' PoS, prefixed with 4-digit zone number and hyphen.
Steps.Expected Result: Seller Agency Code format matches specification for both standard and 'Corner' PoS.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that date fields (Competence Day, Cash day, Winning payment Day) are in 'yyyy-mm-dd' format.
Steps.Expected Result: All date fields are correctly formatted.

Steps.Step Description: Compare the aggregated data in Zenit with the DWH source to ensure consistency and accuracy.
Steps.Expected Result: Zenit data matches DWH source data in content and aggregation logic.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. DWH system has completed daily extraction and report generation for the day.
2. Zenit system is operational and configured to connect to DWH.
3. Test environment contains sample data for sport tickets paid at other sales points, including both standard and 'Corner' PoS.
test_cases.Dataset: Sample DWH report with sport tickets paid at other PoS, including various PoS types, dates, and amounts.
test_cases.Expected Result: Zenit system acquires, aggregates, and formats sport tickets paid at other PoS data from DWH daily, matching all field and format requirements.

test_cases.Title: UserProfileManagement-XPSZENIT200_FullAccessUser_AllFeaturesAccess_DESKTOP_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Login to the ZENIT Dashboard as a user with the 'Full Access User' role.
Steps.Expected Result: User is successfully authenticated and redirected to the Dashboard.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate through all available features: data consultation, data extraction, massive import, and threshold management.
Steps.Expected Result: All features are visible and accessible to the user.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to perform each action: consult data, extract data, perform a massive import, and manage thresholds.
Steps.Expected Result: All actions are successfully performed without any access restriction messages.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. User account exists with 'Full Access User' role assigned.
2. User is assigned to at least one group with full access privileges.
3. ZENIT Dashboard is accessible.
test_cases.Dataset: Full Access User credentials; test data for consultation, extraction, import, and threshold management.
test_cases.Expected Result: Full Access User can access and perform all ZENIT features without restriction.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers only Full Access User role for all features.

test_cases.Title: UserProfileManagement-XPSZENIT200_OperatorUser_PartialFeaturesAccess_DESKTOP_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Expected Result: Data consultation and extraction features are accessible. Threshold management is partially accessible.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to perform a massive import operation.
Steps.Expected Result: Massive import feature is not visible or access is denied with an appropriate message.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. User account exists with 'Operator User' role assigned.
2. User is assigned to a group with operator privileges.
3. ZENIT Dashboard is accessible.
test_cases.Dataset: Operator User credentials; test data for consultation, extraction, and threshold management.
test_cases.Expected Result: Operator User can access consultation, extraction, and partial threshold management features, but cannot access massive import.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers Operator User role and feature restrictions.

test_cases.Title: UserProfileManagement-XPSZENIT200_ObserverUser_ConsultationExtractionOnly_DESKTOP_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Login to the ZENIT Dashboard as a user with the 'Observer User' role.
Steps.Expected Result: User is successfully authenticated and redirected to the Dashboard.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to access data consultation and extraction features.
Steps.Expected Result: Data consultation and extraction features are accessible.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to access threshold management and massive import features.
Steps.Expected Result: Threshold management and massive import features are not visible or access is denied with an appropriate message.

test_cases.Expected Result: Observer User can only access consultation and extraction features; all other features are restricted.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers Observer User role and feature restrictions.

test_cases.Title: UserProfileManagement-XPSZENIT200_ITSupportUser_LogAccessOnly_DESKTOP_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Login to the ZENIT Dashboard as a user with the 'IT Support' role.
Steps.Expected Result: User is successfully authenticated and redirected to the Dashboard.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to access log information via Splunk integration.
Steps.Expected Result: Log information is accessible in read-only mode.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to access any other ZENIT features (consultation, extraction, import, threshold management).
Steps.Expected Result: All other features are not visible or access is denied with an appropriate message.

test_cases.Expected Result: IT Support User can only access log information in read-only mode; all other features are restricted.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers IT Support User role and log access restriction.

test_cases.Title: UserProfileManagement-XPSZENIT200_MultiCountryRoleAssignment_DESKTOP_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Login to the ZENIT Dashboard as a user assigned with different roles for two countries (e.g., Full Access for Italy, Observer for Albania).
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated and can select or view country-specific dashboards.

Steps.Step Description: Switch to the Italy dashboard and attempt to access all features.
Steps.Expected Result: All features are accessible as per Full Access User role.

Steps.Step Description: Switch to the Albania dashboard and attempt to access all features.
Steps.Expected Result: Only consultation and extraction features are accessible as per Observer User role; other features are restricted.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. User account exists with multiple country role assignments.
2. User is assigned to appropriate groups for each country.
3. ZENIT Dashboard is accessible.
4. Country switching functionality is enabled.
test_cases.Dataset: User credentials with Full Access for Italy and Observer for Albania; test data for both countries.
test_cases.Expected Result: User can access features according to their assigned role for each country.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers multi-country role assignment and feature access.

test_cases.Title: UserProfileManagement-XPSZENIT200_GroupRoleAssignment_ApplicationNavigation_DESKTOP_TEST_Desktop

test_cases.Expected Result: User can access only those features allowed by their group's assigned roles.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers group-based role assignment and navigation.

test_cases.Title: Login_XPS-ZENIT-201_Login_Successful_Authentication_DESKTOP_TEST

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the ZENIT back-office login page on a desktop browser.
Steps.Expected Result: ZENIT login screen is displayed with an 'Access' button.

Steps.Step Description: Click the 'Access' button.
Steps.Expected Result: User is redirected to the Microsoft login page.

Steps.Step Description: Enter valid company username and password, then submit.
Steps.Expected Result: System accepts credentials and prompts for second factor authentication.

Steps.Step Description: Approve the authentication request via push notification in the Authenticator App or enter a valid OTP code from the app.
Steps.Expected Result: System verifies the second factor and authenticates the user.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the landing page after successful login.
Steps.Expected Result: User is redirected to the home page appropriate for their role, with a clear indication of the current environment (e.g., TEST).

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. User is pre-registered in ZENIT with an enabled profile.
2. User has configured MFA and the Authenticator App on their mobile device.
3. System is configured to support MFA.
4. User has access to a desktop computer and a supported browser.
test_cases.Dataset: Valid company username and password; Authenticator App configured for the user.
test_cases.Expected Result: User is authenticated, redirected to the correct home page, and the environment is clearly displayed.

test_cases.Title: Login_XPS-ZENIT-201_Login_Invalid_Credentials_Error_DESKTOP_TEST

test_cases.Title: AutoLogout-XPS202_Inactivity_LogoutFunctionality_DESKTOP_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the ZENIT system with valid credentials on a desktop device.
Steps.Expected Result: User is successfully logged in and the main dashboard is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Remain completely inactive (no mouse movement, clicks, or keyboard input) for 5 minutes.
Steps.Expected Result: No user activity is detected by the system for 5 minutes.

Steps.Step Description: Observe if a notification or pop-up warning about impending session expiration appears after 5 minutes of inactivity.
Steps.Expected Result: A notification or pop-up appears, warning the user that the session will expire soon due to inactivity, possibly with a countdown timer.

Steps.Step Description: Do not interact with the system after the notification appears. Wait for the countdown to complete.
Steps.Expected Result: The system automatically logs out the user after the countdown expires.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the post-logout behavior.
Steps.Expected Result: User is redirected to the login screen and cannot access any features without logging in again.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. User has a valid ZENIT account.
2. User is logged into the ZENIT system on a desktop device.
3. No other active sessions for the same user.
test_cases.Dataset: Valid user credentials (e.g., user1/password1)
test_cases.Expected Result: The user is automatically logged out after 5 minutes of inactivity, receives a warning notification before logout, and is redirected to the login screen. The disconnect event is logged in the system logs.

test_cases.Title: AutoLogout-XPS202_Notification_ContinueSession_DESKTOP_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the ZENIT system with valid credentials on a desktop device.
Steps.Expected Result: User is successfully logged in and the main dashboard is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Remain inactive for 5 minutes.
Steps.Expected Result: No user activity is detected by the system for 5 minutes.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the notification or pop-up warning about impending session expiration.
Steps.Expected Result: A notification or pop-up appears, warning the user that the session will expire soon due to inactivity, with a 'Continue' button.

Steps.Step Description: Click the 'Continue' button within the countdown period.
Steps.Expected Result: The session remains active, the notification disappears, and the user is not logged out.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. User has a valid ZENIT account.
2. User is logged into the ZENIT system on a desktop device.
test_cases.Dataset: Valid user credentials (e.g., user2/password2)
test_cases.Expected Result: The user receives a notification after 5 minutes of inactivity and, upon clicking 'Continue', the session remains active without logout.

test_cases.Title: AutoLogout-XPS202_ActiveUser_NoLogout_DESKTOP_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the ZENIT system with valid credentials on a desktop device.
Steps.Expected Result: User is successfully logged in and the main dashboard is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Perform periodic interactions (e.g., mouse movement, clicks, or typing) at intervals less than 5 minutes for a total duration of 10 minutes.
Steps.Expected Result: User activity is continuously detected by the system.

Steps.Step Description: Observe if any inactivity notification or automatic logout occurs during this period.
Steps.Expected Result: No inactivity notification or automatic logout occurs; the session remains active.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. User has a valid ZENIT account.
2. User is logged into the ZENIT system on a desktop device.
test_cases.Dataset: Valid user credentials (e.g., user3/password3)
test_cases.Expected Result: As long as the user remains active, no inactivity notification or automatic logout is triggered.

test_cases.Title: LoginTracking-XPS203_LoginTracking_RegistrationOfAccess_DESKTOP_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Launch the application on a desktop device.
Steps.Expected Result: Application launches successfully.

Steps.Step Description: Enter valid username and password credentials for a test user.
Steps.Expected Result: Credentials are entered.

Steps.Step Description: Click the 'Login' button to authenticate.
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated and granted access to the application.

Steps.Step Description: Query the secure database for the latest login record for the test user.
Steps.Expected Result: A new login record is present in the database for the test user.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the login record contains the following fields: Username, Surname and First Name, Email Address, Title, Department, Date of Last Login, Status of the Username, and Role.
Steps.Expected Result: All required fields are present and correctly populated in the login record.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. Test user account is created with all required profile information (Username, Surname, First Name, Email, Title, Department, Status, Role).
2. Tester has access to the secure database for verification.
3. Application is deployed and accessible on the desktop environment.
test_cases.Dataset: Test user credentials (e.g., username: testuser1, password: Test@1234) and expected profile data.
test_cases.Expected Result: Upon successful login, a new record is created in the secure database with all required fields accurately populated for the authenticated user.

test_cases.Title: AccessLoginTracking_XPS-ZENIT-204_ViewLoginTracking_Splunk_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the Splunk application with valid credentials as a member of the Control Room (IT Support) team.
Steps.Expected Result: User is successfully authenticated and granted access to the Splunk dashboard.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the dashboard or section dedicated to ZENIT system login tracking information.
Steps.Expected Result: The dashboard or section for ZENIT login tracking is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that login tracking records from the ZENIT system are visible and accessible.
Steps.Expected Result: Login tracking records are displayed, including relevant details such as username, timestamp, and login status.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. User account exists in the Control Room (IT Support) group.
2. User has valid Splunk credentials.
3. ZENIT system is configured to send login tracking data to Splunk.
4. Splunk application is accessible from the test environment.
test_cases.Dataset: Control Room user credentials; Sample ZENIT login tracking data.
test_cases.Expected Result: Authorized Control Room users can view ZENIT login tracking information in Splunk.

test_cases.Title: AccessDenied_XPS-ZENIT-204_UnauthorizedUserBlocked_Splunk_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the Splunk application with valid credentials as a user NOT belonging to the Control Room (IT Support) team.
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated but does not have access to the ZENIT login tracking dashboard or section.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to access the ZENIT login tracking information section.
Steps.Expected Result: Access is denied, and an appropriate error or access denied message is displayed.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. User account exists but is NOT part of the Control Room (IT Support) group.
2. User has valid Splunk credentials.
3. ZENIT system is configured to send login tracking data to Splunk.
4. Splunk application is accessible from the test environment.
test_cases.Dataset: Non-Control Room user credentials; Sample ZENIT login tracking data.
test_cases.Expected Result: Unauthorized users cannot access ZENIT login tracking information in Splunk.

test_cases.Title: DataIntegrity_XPS-ZENIT-204_VerifyTrackingDataAccuracy_Splunk_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the Splunk application as a Control Room (IT Support) user.
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated and has access to the ZENIT login tracking dashboard.

Steps.Step Description: Compare the login tracking records displayed in Splunk with the source records from the ZENIT system for a specific time period.
Steps.Expected Result: The records in Splunk match the source records from ZENIT in terms of count, timestamps, usernames, and statuses.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. User account exists in the Control Room (IT Support) group.
2. User has valid Splunk credentials.
3. ZENIT system is configured to send login tracking data to Splunk.
4. Sample login tracking data is available in both ZENIT and Splunk for comparison.
test_cases.Dataset: Control Room user credentials; Sample ZENIT login tracking data; Source ZENIT records for comparison.
test_cases.Expected Result: Login tracking data in Splunk accurately reflects the source data from ZENIT.

test_cases.Title: FilterSearch_XPS-ZENIT-204_FilterLoginTracking_Splunk_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the Splunk application as a Control Room (IT Support) user.
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated and has access to the ZENIT login tracking dashboard.

Steps.Step Description: Apply filters (e.g., by username, date range, login status) to the ZENIT login tracking data.
Steps.Expected Result: Filtered results are displayed according to the selected criteria.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. User account exists in the Control Room (IT Support) group.
2. User has valid Splunk credentials.
3. ZENIT system is configured to send login tracking data to Splunk.
4. Sufficient login tracking data exists for filtering.
test_cases.Dataset: Control Room user credentials; Sample ZENIT login tracking data with varied usernames, dates, and statuses.
test_cases.Expected Result: ZENIT login tracking data can be filtered and searched as expected in Splunk.

test_cases.Title: NoData_XPS-ZENIT-204_EmptyTrackingData_Splunk_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the Splunk application as a Control Room (IT Support) user.
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated and has access to the ZENIT login tracking dashboard.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the ZENIT login tracking section when no login tracking data is available for the selected period.
Steps.Expected Result: A message indicating that no data is available is displayed, and the dashboard remains functional.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. User account exists in the Control Room (IT Support) group.
2. User has valid Splunk credentials.
3. ZENIT system is configured to send login tracking data to Splunk.
4. No login tracking data exists for the selected period.
test_cases.Dataset: Control Room user credentials; No ZENIT login tracking data for the selected period.
test_cases.Expected Result: System gracefully handles the absence of login tracking data and informs the user appropriately.

test_cases.Title: ConcurrentUpdate_XPS-ZENIT-210_ManageConcurrency_DataConsistency_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: User A logs into the system and opens Record X for editing.
Steps.Expected Result: User A successfully accesses Record X in edit mode.

Steps.Step Description: User B logs into the system and opens the same Record X for editing simultaneously.
Steps.Expected Result: User B successfully accesses Record X in edit mode.

Steps.Step Description: User A modifies a field in Record X and saves the changes.
Steps.Expected Result: System saves User A's changes and confirms the update.

Steps.Step Description: User B modifies a different field in Record X and attempts to save the changes.
Steps.Expected Result: System detects concurrent modification and either merges changes, prompts User B to review changes, or prevents overwrite, ensuring no data loss or inconsistency.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. System is deployed and accessible.
2. Record X exists in the database.
3. Two valid user accounts (User A and User B) are available.
test_cases.Dataset: User A and User B credentials; Record X with known initial values.
test_cases.Expected Result: The system maintains data consistency and integrity, preventing conflicting updates to Record X by multiple users.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers concurrent update scenario for a single record.

test_cases.Title: SimultaneousCreate_XPS-ZENIT-210_ManageConcurrency_DuplicatePrevention_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: User A and User B log into the system simultaneously.
Steps.Expected Result: Both users are authenticated and have access to the application.

Steps.Step Description: Both users attempt to create a new record with the same unique identifier (e.g., same email or ID) at the same time.
Steps.Expected Result: System processes both requests concurrently.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the system's response to both creation attempts.
Steps.Expected Result: System allows only one record to be created with the unique identifier, and the other user receives an error or notification about the duplicate.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. System is deployed and accessible.
2. Two valid user accounts (User A and User B) are available.
3. No existing record with the test unique identifier.
test_cases.Dataset: User A and User B credentials; unique identifier value for new record creation.
test_cases.Expected Result: The system prevents duplicate records from being created during simultaneous requests, ensuring data integrity.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers concurrent creation and duplicate prevention.

test_cases.Title: ConcurrentReadWrite_XPS-ZENIT-210_ManageConcurrency_ReadWhileWrite_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: User A logs into the system and opens Record Y for editing.
Steps.Expected Result: User A accesses Record Y in edit mode.

Steps.Step Description: User B logs into the system and opens the same Record Y for viewing (read-only mode).
Steps.Expected Result: User B accesses Record Y in view mode.

Steps.Step Description: User A modifies and saves changes to Record Y.
Steps.Expected Result: System saves User A's changes and confirms the update.

Steps.Step Description: User B refreshes the view of Record Y after User A's save.
Steps.Expected Result: User B sees the updated data reflecting User A's changes, ensuring data consistency.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. System is deployed and accessible.
2. Record Y exists in the database.
3. Two valid user accounts (User A and User B) are available.
test_cases.Dataset: User A and User B credentials; Record Y with known initial values.
test_cases.Expected Result: The system ensures that users viewing data see the most recent committed changes, maintaining data consistency during concurrent read/write operations.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers concurrent read and write scenario for a single record.

test_cases.Title: BulkConcurrentAccess_XPS-ZENIT-210_ManageConcurrency_StressSimultaneousUsers_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Simulate 50 users logging into the system and accessing the same dataset simultaneously.
Steps.Expected Result: All users are authenticated and can access the dataset without errors.

Steps.Step Description: All users attempt to perform read and write operations on different records within the dataset at the same time.
Steps.Expected Result: System processes all operations without data loss, corruption, or performance degradation.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. System is deployed and accessible.
2. Test environment supports simulation of 50 concurrent users.
3. Dataset with multiple records exists.
test_cases.Dataset: Test user pool (50 accounts); dataset with multiple records.
test_cases.Expected Result: The system maintains data consistency and integrity under high concurrent load, with no errors or data conflicts.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers high-load concurrency and stress scenario.

test_cases.Title: TransactionRollback_XPS-ZENIT-210_ManageConcurrency_ConflictRollback_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: User A logs into the system and begins editing Record Z.
Steps.Expected Result: User A accesses Record Z in edit mode.

Steps.Step Description: User B logs into the system and begins editing the same Record Z.
Steps.Expected Result: User B accesses Record Z in edit mode.

Steps.Step Description: User A saves changes to Record Z.
Steps.Expected Result: System saves User A's changes and confirms the update.

Steps.Step Description: User B attempts to save conflicting changes to Record Z.
Steps.Expected Result: System detects the conflict and either rolls back User B's transaction or prompts User B to resolve the conflict, ensuring no data inconsistency.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. System is deployed and accessible.
2. Record Z exists in the database.
3. Two valid user accounts (User A and User B) are available.
test_cases.Dataset: User A and User B credentials; Record Z with known initial values.
test_cases.Expected Result: The system prevents data inconsistency by rolling back or resolving conflicting transactions during concurrent edits.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers transaction rollback and conflict resolution scenario.

test_cases.Title: LogAudit-proj_001_log_creation_and_content_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Access the log/audit system or file.
Steps.Expected Result: Log/audit file or system is accessible.

Steps.Step Description: Locate the log entry corresponding to the performed action.
Steps.Expected Result: A log entry for the action exists.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the log entry contains all required information (timestamp, user ID, action performed, status, etc.).
Steps.Expected Result: Log entry contains accurate and complete information as per requirements.

test_cases.Preconditions:

test_cases.Expected Result: A log entry is created for the user action, containing all required and accurate information.

test_cases.Title: LogAudit-proj_001_log_integrity_and_tamper_detection_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Access the log/audit file or system.
Steps.Expected Result: Log/audit file or system is accessible.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to modify or delete the generated log entry (if permissions allow).

test_cases.Preconditions:

test_cases.Expected Result: Log entries cannot be tampered with without detection; unauthorized modifications are prevented or logged.

test_cases.Title: LogAudit-proj_001_log_retention_and_deletion_policy_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Perform actions that generate log entries over a period exceeding the retention policy (simulate if necessary).

Steps.Step Description: Check the log/audit system for entries older than the retention period.
Steps.Expected Result: Log entries older than the retention period are deleted or archived as per policy.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. Log/audit system is enabled and configured.

test_cases.Expected Result: Log entries are retained and deleted/archived according to the defined retention policy.

test_cases.Title: LogAudit-proj_001_log_access_control_and_auditability_TEST_Desktop

test_cases.Title: LogTemplate_XPS-ZENIT-220_LogFormatValidation_OperationsTracking_TEST_Backend_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Perform a modification operation on the database (e.g., update a user record) via the application.
Steps.Expected Result: A log entry is generated for the operation.

Steps.Step Description: Retrieve the generated log entry from the log storage system.
Steps.Expected Result: The log entry is accessible for review by authorized personnel.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the log entry description matches the required template: #*<applicationName>*# #AUDIT# #*<actionCategory>*# User '<username>' having role '<userRole>' has performed the following action: <actionDescription>
Steps.Expected Result: The log entry strictly follows the specified template with correct values for applicationName, actionCategory, username, userRole, and actionDescription.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1. Application is deployed and configured with log traceability management enabled. 2. Test user account with modification privileges is available. 3. Access to log storage system is granted for test purposes.
test_cases.Dataset: Test user: johndoe, Role: admin, Application: XPS-ZENIT, Action: Update user email, ActionCategory: DB_MODIFICATION
test_cases.Expected Result: All modification operation logs strictly follow the required template format.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers only log format validation for modification operations.

test_cases.Title: LogRetention_XPS-ZENIT-220_LogRetentionPolicy_OperationsTracking_TEST_Backend_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Perform a modification operation that triggers an audit log entry.
Steps.Expected Result: A log entry is generated and stored.

Steps.Step Description: Wait for the standard log retention period to expire (simulate or configure a short retention for test).
Steps.Expected Result: Standard logs are purged according to policy.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the audit log entry generated in Step 1 is still retained beyond the standard log retention period.
Steps.Expected Result: Audit log entry is still present and accessible after standard logs are purged.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1. Application is configured with differentiated log retention policies (audit logs vs. standard logs). 2. Access to log storage system. 3. Ability to simulate or configure log retention periods for testing.
test_cases.Dataset: Audit log entry generated by user johndoe, Role: admin, Application: XPS-ZENIT, Action: Update user email
test_cases.Expected Result: Audit logs are retained longer than standard logs as per configuration.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers retention policy for audit logs only.

test_cases.Title: LogImmutability_XPS-ZENIT-220_LogImmutability_OperationsTracking_TEST_Backend_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Perform a modification operation that generates an audit log entry.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to delete the audit log entry via direct database/file access or application interface.

test_cases.Expected Result: Audit log entries are immutable and cannot be modified or deleted after creation.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers immutability for audit logs only.

test_cases.Title: LogSecurity_XPS-ZENIT-220_LogAccessControl_OperationsTracking_TEST_Backend_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to access audit log entries as an authorized user (e.g., user with audit log access privileges).

test_cases.Title: CreditManagement-XPS330_Requirement_CreditLineFieldCalculations_Dashboard_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the Dashboard application as a user with access to a PoS with at least one credit line.
Steps.Expected Result: User is successfully logged in and redirected to the PoS overview page.

Steps.Step Description: Select the relevant PoS from the list.
Steps.Expected Result: The PoS detail page is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the 'Credit Management' section (should be active by default).
Steps.Expected Result: The 'Credit Management' section is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: For a selected credit line, note the values for Base Amount and Extension Amount.
Steps.Expected Result: Base Amount and Extension Amount are displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the Total value equals the sum of Base Amount and Extension Amount.
Steps.Expected Result: Total = Base Amount + Extension Amount.

Steps.Step Description: Note the Consumed value and verify that % Consumed equals (Consumed / Total) * 100%.
Steps.Expected Result: % Consumed is correctly calculated and displayed as a percentage.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that Residue equals Total minus Consumed.
Steps.Expected Result: Residue = Total - Consumed.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. User account with valid credentials and access to a PoS with at least one credit line.
2. Dashboard application is accessible from a desktop browser.
test_cases.Dataset: User credentials, PoS identifier with credit lines and known values for Base, Extension, and Consumed.
test_cases.Expected Result: All credit line fields (Total, % Consumed, Residue) are calculated and displayed correctly according to the provided formulas.
