test_cases.Title: CervedUnavailable_XPS-ZENIT-380_Dashboard_DocumentsSectionError_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Simulate Cerved system unavailability (e.g., disconnect Cerved API endpoint or use invalid credentials).
Steps.Expected Result: Cerved system is unreachable from the ZENIT application.

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the ZENIT dashboard with a user account that has privileges to view Cerved and Arxivar documents.
Steps.Expected Result: User is successfully logged in and dashboard is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the 'Documents' section from the dashboard menu.
Steps.Expected Result: An error message is displayed indicating that the Cerved system is not available. Documents from Arxivar (if available) are still shown.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. User account with privileges to view Cerved and Arxivar documents exists.
2. User is not logged in.
3. Cerved system is intentionally made unavailable; Arxivar system is reachable and contains at least one document.
test_cases.Dataset: Valid ZENIT user credentials; at least one document in Arxivar system; Cerved system unavailable.
test_cases.Expected Result: An error message is shown for Cerved unavailability, and documents from Arxivar are displayed if available.

test_cases.Title: ArxivarUnavailable_XPS-ZENIT-380_Dashboard_DocumentsSectionError_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Simulate Arxivar system unavailability (e.g., disconnect Arxivar API endpoint or use invalid credentials).
Steps.Expected Result: Arxivar system is unreachable from the ZENIT application.

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the ZENIT dashboard with a user account that has privileges to view Cerved and Arxivar documents.
Steps.Expected Result: User is successfully logged in and dashboard is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the 'Documents' section from the dashboard menu.
Steps.Expected Result: An error message is displayed indicating that the Arxivar system is not available. Documents from Cerved (if available) are still shown.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. User account with privileges to view Cerved and Arxivar documents exists.
2. User is not logged in.
3. Arxivar system is intentionally made unavailable; Cerved system is reachable and contains at least one document.
test_cases.Dataset: Valid ZENIT user credentials; at least one document in Cerved system; Arxivar system unavailable.
test_cases.Expected Result: An error message is shown for Arxivar unavailability, and documents from Cerved are displayed if available.

test_cases.Title: NoDocuments_XPS-ZENIT-380_Dashboard_EmptyDocumentsList_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Ensure both Cerved and Arxivar systems have no documents available for the user.
Steps.Expected Result: Both systems return empty document lists.

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the ZENIT dashboard with a user account that has privileges to view Cerved and Arxivar documents.
Steps.Expected Result: User is successfully logged in and dashboard is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the 'Documents' section from the dashboard menu.
Steps.Expected Result: A message is displayed indicating that no documents are available from either source.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. User account with privileges to view Cerved and Arxivar documents exists.
2. User is not logged in.
3. Both Cerved and Arxivar systems are reachable but contain no documents for the user.
test_cases.Dataset: Valid ZENIT user credentials; no documents in both Cerved and Arxivar systems.
test_cases.Expected Result: A clear message is shown indicating that no documents are available from either source.

test_cases.Title: NotesDisplay-XPSZENIT385_Dashboard_ViewNotes_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the ZENIT dashboard as a user with permission to view notes.
Steps.Expected Result: User is successfully logged in and dashboard is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the Single PoS dashboard for a POS with existing notes.
Steps.Expected Result: Single PoS dashboard is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Click on the 'Notes' section/tab.
Steps.Expected Result: Notes section is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the list of notes displayed.
Steps.Expected Result: All notes associated with the POS are displayed, sorted by date in descending order (most recent at the top).

Steps.Step Description: Verify that each note displays the insert date, author, and text content.
Steps.Expected Result: Each note shows the correct insert date, author, and note content.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. User account exists with permission to view notes.
2. User is logged into the ZENIT dashboard.
3. POS selected has at least one note recorded.
test_cases.Dataset: User credentials with view permission; POS with existing notes.
test_cases.Expected Result: Notes section displays all notes for the POS, sorted by most recent, each with date, author, and content.

test_cases.Title: NotesEmpty-XPSZENIT385_Dashboard_NoNotesPresent_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the ZENIT dashboard as a user with permission to view notes.
Steps.Expected Result: User is successfully logged in and dashboard is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the Single PoS dashboard for a POS with no notes recorded.
Steps.Expected Result: Single PoS dashboard is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Click on the 'Notes' section/tab.
Steps.Expected Result: Notes section is displayed.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. User account exists with permission to view notes.
2. User is logged into the ZENIT dashboard.
3. POS selected has no notes recorded.
test_cases.Dataset: User credentials with view permission; POS with no notes.
test_cases.Expected Result: A message 'No notes present for this POS' is displayed in the Notes section.

test_cases.Title: NotesUnauthorized-XPSZENIT385_Dashboard_NotesPermissionDenied_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the ZENIT dashboard as a user without permission to view notes.
Steps.Expected Result: User is successfully logged in and dashboard is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the Single PoS dashboard for any POS.
Steps.Expected Result: Single PoS dashboard is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to access the 'Notes' section/tab.
Steps.Expected Result: Notes section is hidden or disabled. A message such as 'Unauthorized access to the POS note' is displayed.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. User account exists without permission to view notes.
2. User is logged into the ZENIT dashboard.
test_cases.Dataset: User credentials without view permission.
test_cases.Expected Result: Notes section is inaccessible and an unauthorized access message is shown.

test_cases.Title: NotesAdd-XPSZENIT385_Dashboard_AddNote_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the ZENIT dashboard as a user with permission to add notes.
Steps.Expected Result: User is successfully logged in and dashboard is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the Single PoS dashboard for a POS.
Steps.Expected Result: Single PoS dashboard is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Click on the 'Notes' section/tab.
Steps.Expected Result: Notes section is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Enter text into the editable note field.
Steps.Expected Result: Text is entered into the note field.

Steps.Step Description: Click the 'Save' button.
Steps.Expected Result: Note is saved, appears at the top of the notes list with correct metadata (date, author, content).

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the operation is logged in the system logs (user, date/time, operation, note content).
Steps.Expected Result: System log contains an entry for the note addition with all required details.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. User account exists with permission to add notes.
2. User is logged into the ZENIT dashboard.
3. POS selected is accessible.
test_cases.Dataset: User credentials with add permission; sample note text.
test_cases.Expected Result: New note is added, displayed at the top of the list, and operation is logged with all required metadata.

test_cases.Title: NotesAddCancel-XPSZENIT385_Dashboard_CancelAddNote_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the ZENIT dashboard as a user with permission to add notes.
Steps.Expected Result: User is successfully logged in and dashboard is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the Single PoS dashboard for a POS.
Steps.Expected Result: Single PoS dashboard is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Click on the 'Notes' section/tab.
Steps.Expected Result: Notes section is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Enter text into the editable note field.
Steps.Expected Result: Text is entered into the note field.

Steps.Step Description: Click the 'Cancel' button.
Steps.Expected Result: Note is not saved, and the note field is cleared or closed. No new note appears in the list.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. User account exists with permission to add notes.
2. User is logged into the ZENIT dashboard.
3. POS selected is accessible.
test_cases.Dataset: User credentials with add permission; sample note text.
test_cases.Expected Result: No new note is added when the operation is cancelled.

test_cases.Title: RelatedPoS-XPSZENIT390_Dashboard_AccessAndAutoSearch_DESKTOP_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Log in as a ZENIT user with privileges to view Related PoS.
Steps.Expected Result: User is successfully logged in and lands on the dashboard.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the 'Single PoS' dashboard and select a PoS.
Steps.Expected Result: The 'Single PoS' dashboard for the selected PoS is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Access the 'Related PoS' section within the dashboard.
Steps.Expected Result: The system automatically initiates a search for related PoS, excluding closed PoS by default.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the results area.
Steps.Expected Result: A table or list is displayed with related PoS, each row representing a single PoS, including columns for PoS data and relationship info. If no results, a notification is shown and no table is displayed.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. User account with 'view Related PoS' privileges exists.
2. User is logged into the ZENIT system.
3. At least one PoS is available in the system.
test_cases.Dataset: User credentials with appropriate privileges; at least one PoS with related PoS in the database.
test_cases.Expected Result: Upon accessing the 'Related PoS' section, the system automatically searches and displays a table of related PoS (excluding closed PoS by default), or a notification if none are found.

test_cases.Title: RelatedPoS-XPSZENIT390_Dashboard_IncludeClosedPoS_DESKTOP_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Log in as a ZENIT user with privileges to view Related PoS.
Steps.Expected Result: User is successfully logged in.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the 'Single PoS' dashboard and select a PoS.
Steps.Expected Result: The 'Single PoS' dashboard for the selected PoS is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Access the 'Related PoS' section.
Steps.Expected Result: The 'Related PoS' section is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Select the checkbox 'Include closed PoS'.
Steps.Expected Result: The system re-initiates the search, now including closed PoS in the comparison.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the results area.
Steps.Expected Result: The table or list now includes related PoS that are closed, if any exist. Each row represents a single PoS, with relationship info.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. User account with 'view Related PoS' privileges exists.
2. User is logged into the ZENIT system.
3. At least one PoS is available in the system.
4. There are closed PoS in the database related to the selected PoS.
test_cases.Dataset: User credentials; PoS with related closed PoS in the database.
test_cases.Expected Result: When the 'Include closed PoS' checkbox is selected, the system includes closed PoS in the results table if any match the criteria.

test_cases.Title: RelatedPoS-XPSZENIT390_Dashboard_NoResultsScenario_DESKTOP_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Log in as a ZENIT user with privileges to view Related PoS.
Steps.Expected Result: User is successfully logged in.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the 'Single PoS' dashboard and select a PoS with no related PoS in the system.
Steps.Expected Result: The 'Single PoS' dashboard for the selected PoS is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Access the 'Related PoS' section.
Steps.Expected Result: The system automatically initiates a search for related PoS.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the results area.
Steps.Expected Result: A notification is displayed indicating that no results were found. No table is displayed. The 'Export to Excel' button is disabled or not visible.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. User account with 'view Related PoS' privileges exists.
2. User is logged into the ZENIT system.
3. At least one PoS exists with no related PoS in the database.
test_cases.Dataset: User credentials; PoS with no related PoS in the database.
test_cases.Expected Result: If no related PoS are found, a notification is shown, no table is displayed, and the 'Export to Excel' button is disabled or hidden.

test_cases.Title: RelatedPoS-XPSZENIT390_Dashboard_ExportToExcel_DESKTOP_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Log in as a ZENIT user with privileges to view Related PoS.
Steps.Expected Result: User is successfully logged in.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the 'Single PoS' dashboard and select a PoS with related PoS in the system.
Steps.Expected Result: The 'Single PoS' dashboard for the selected PoS is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Access the 'Related PoS' section.
Steps.Expected Result: The system displays a table of related PoS.

Steps.Step Description: Click the 'Export to Excel' button.
Steps.Expected Result: The system generates and downloads an Excel file containing the displayed related PoS data.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. User account with 'view Related PoS' privileges exists.
2. User is logged into the ZENIT system.
3. At least one PoS exists with related PoS in the database.
test_cases.Dataset: User credentials; PoS with related PoS in the database.
test_cases.Expected Result: When related PoS results are displayed, clicking 'Export to Excel' downloads an Excel file with the same data as shown in the table.

test_cases.Title: RelatedPoS-XPSZENIT390_Dashboard_SelectPoSDetails_DESKTOP_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Log in as a ZENIT user with privileges to view Related PoS.
Steps.Expected Result: User is successfully logged in.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the 'Single PoS' dashboard and select a PoS with related PoS in the system.
Steps.Expected Result: The 'Single PoS' dashboard for the selected PoS is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Access the 'Related PoS' section and wait for the results table to appear.
Steps.Expected Result: A table of related PoS is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Click the edit icon next to a related PoS in the table.
Steps.Expected Result: The system retrieves and displays the details of the selected PoS on the 'Single PoS' screen.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. User account with 'view Related PoS' privileges exists.
2. User is logged into the ZENIT system.
3. At least one PoS exists with related PoS in the database.
test_cases.Dataset: User credentials; PoS with related PoS in the database.
test_cases.Expected Result: Clicking the edit icon for a related PoS displays its details in the 'Single PoS' view.

test_cases.Title: RelatedPoS-XPSZENIT390_Dashboard_DatabaseError_DESKTOP_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Log in as a ZENIT user with privileges to view Related PoS.
Steps.Expected Result: User is successfully logged in.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the 'Single PoS' dashboard and select a PoS.
Steps.Expected Result: The 'Single PoS' dashboard for the selected PoS is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Access the 'Related PoS' section.
Steps.Expected Result: The system attempts to retrieve related PoS data.

Steps.Step Description: Simulate a database connection error or timeout (e.g., disconnect the database or use a test environment with forced error).
Steps.Expected Result: The system displays an error message to the user: 'Error retrieving data'.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. User account with 'view Related PoS' privileges exists.
2. User is logged into the ZENIT system.
3. At least one PoS exists in the system.
4. Test environment allows simulation of database errors.
test_cases.Dataset: User credentials; ability to simulate database error.
test_cases.Expected Result: If a database connection error or timeout occurs, the system displays an error message: 'Error retrieving data'.

test_cases.Title: MassiveImporter_proj1_InformationalMessageOnIntegrationAttempt_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Ensure the integration with the data owner's system is active in Zenit.
Steps.Expected Result: Integration status is active.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the Massive Importer section in Zenit.
Steps.Expected Result: Massive Importer interface is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to initiate a new data import using the Massive Importer.
Steps.Expected Result: An informational message is displayed, notifying the user that the integration is active and the Massive Importer should only be used as a backup.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. User has valid credentials and is logged into Zenit.
2. Integration with the data owner's system is active.
3. User has access to the Massive Importer feature.
test_cases.Dataset: N/A
test_cases.Expected Result: When the user attempts to use the Massive Importer while integration is active, an informational message is displayed, and the user is advised to use the importer only as a backup.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers only the informational message display when integration is active.

test_cases.Title: MassiveImporter_proj1_ExcelTemplateStructureValidation_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Obtain the official Excel template for a specific data type from Zenit.
Steps.Expected Result: Official template is downloaded and available.

Steps.Step Description: Prepare an Excel file by copying data into the template, ensuring no changes to structure, format, or cell types.
Steps.Expected Result: Excel file matches the template structure exactly.

Steps.Step Description: Upload the prepared Excel file via the Massive Importer interface.
Steps.Expected Result: File is accepted for import without errors.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. User is logged into Zenit with import permissions.
2. Official Excel template is available.
3. Data to import is available and matches the template requirements.
test_cases.Dataset: Official Excel template, valid data set matching template structure.
test_cases.Expected Result: The system accepts the Excel file for import only if its structure and format exactly match the provided template.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers only the positive scenario for template structure validation.

test_cases.Title: MassiveImporter_proj1_RejectNonXLSXFormatFiles_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Prepare an Excel file in .xls format (not .xlsx) using the correct template structure.
Steps.Expected Result: File is ready in .xls format.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to upload the .xls file via the Massive Importer interface.
Steps.Expected Result: System rejects the file and displays an error message indicating only .xlsx files are accepted.

Steps.Step Description: Repeat steps 1-2 with a .csv file and a file in another unsupported format (e.g., .ods).
Steps.Expected Result: System rejects each file and displays an appropriate error message.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. User is logged into Zenit with import permissions.
2. Official template is available.
3. Files in .xls, .csv, and .ods formats are prepared.
test_cases.Dataset: Excel files in .xls, .csv, and .ods formats with valid data.
test_cases.Expected Result: The system rejects any file that is not in .xlsx format and provides a clear error message to the user.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers negative scenarios for file format validation.

test_cases.Title: MassiveImporter_proj1_RejectFilesWithStructuralDeviations_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Prepare an Excel file based on the template but introduce one or more structural deviations (e.g., extra columns, missing columns, reordered columns, merged cells, or additional worksheets).
Steps.Expected Result: File contains intentional structural deviations.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to upload the structurally altered file via the Massive Importer interface.
Steps.Expected Result: System rejects the file and displays an error message indicating the structure does not match the template.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. User is logged into Zenit with import permissions.
2. Official template is available.
3. Structurally altered Excel file is prepared.
test_cases.Dataset: Excel file with structural deviations (e.g., extra/missing columns, merged cells, extra worksheet).
test_cases.Expected Result: The system rejects any Excel file that does not exactly match the template structure and provides a clear error message.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers negative scenarios for template structure validation.

test_cases.Title: MassiveImporter_proj1_RejectFilesWithFormulas_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Prepare an Excel file using the official template but leave formulas in one or more cells instead of static values.
Steps.Expected Result: Excel file contains formulas in some cells.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to upload the file with formulas via the Massive Importer interface.
Steps.Expected Result: System rejects the file and displays an error message indicating that only static values are allowed.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. User is logged into Zenit with import permissions.
2. Official template is available.
3. Excel file with formulas is prepared.
test_cases.Dataset: Excel file with formulas in one or more cells.
test_cases.Expected Result: The system rejects any Excel file containing formulas and provides a clear error message to the user.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers negative scenario for formula validation.

test_cases.Title: MassiveImporter_proj1_RejectFilesWithEmptyRowsOrMultipleWorksheets_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Prepare an Excel file using the official template but insert empty rows within the data block.
Steps.Expected Result: Excel file contains empty rows within the data block.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to upload the file via the Massive Importer interface.
Steps.Expected Result: System rejects the file and displays an error message indicating empty rows are not allowed.

Steps.Step Description: Prepare another Excel file with more than one worksheet.
Steps.Expected Result: Excel file contains multiple worksheets.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to upload the multi-worksheet file via the Massive Importer interface.
Steps.Expected Result: System rejects the file and displays an error message indicating only one worksheet is allowed.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. User is logged into Zenit with import permissions.
2. Official template is available.
3. Excel files with empty rows and multiple worksheets are prepared.
test_cases.Functionality: Massive Importer - Data Block and Worksheet Validation
test_cases.Dataset: Excel files with empty rows and multiple worksheets.
test_cases.Expected Result: The system rejects Excel files containing empty rows within the data block or multiple worksheets, providing clear error messages.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers negative scenarios for empty rows and worksheet count validation.

test_cases.Title: MassiveImporter_proj1_FileSizeLimitationAndDoubleSubmission_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Prepare a valid Excel file using the official template with a file size just below the maximum allowed limit (e.g., 14.5 MB).
Steps.Expected Result: Excel file is ready and within the size limit.

Steps.Step Description: Upload the file via the Massive Importer interface.
Steps.Expected Result: File is accepted for import.

Steps.Step Description: Prepare another valid Excel file exceeding the maximum allowed size (e.g., 16 MB).
Steps.Expected Result: Excel file exceeds the size limit.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to upload the oversized file via the Massive Importer interface.
Steps.Expected Result: System rejects the file and displays an error message indicating the file size exceeds the allowed limit.

Steps.Step Description: Split the oversized data into two separate files, each within the allowed size limit, and upload them sequentially.
Steps.Expected Result: Both files are accepted for import, provided they adhere to the template structure and size guidelines.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. User is logged into Zenit with import permissions.
2. Official template is available.
3. Excel files of varying sizes are prepared.
test_cases.Dataset: Excel files: one just below the size limit, one above the limit, and two split files within the limit.
test_cases.Expected Result: The system accepts files within the size limit and rejects those exceeding it, allowing double submission for oversized data as per guidelines.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers file size validation and double submission scenario.

test_cases.Title: MassiveImporter_proj1_ImportDataManualVsIntegration_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Refer to the 'ZENIT - Elenco Dati' file to identify data types marked as 'Manual', 'Integration', or 'Both'.
Steps.Expected Result: Data types and their import modes are identified.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to import data marked as 'Manual' using the Massive Importer.
Steps.Expected Result: System allows the import process to proceed.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to import data marked as 'Integration' using the Massive Importer.
Steps.Expected Result: System prevents the import and displays an appropriate message.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to import data marked as 'Both' using the Massive Importer.
Steps.Expected Result: System allows the import process to proceed.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. User is logged into Zenit with import permissions.
2. 'ZENIT - Elenco Dati' file is available.
3. Data files for each import mode are prepared.
test_cases.Dataset: 'ZENIT - Elenco Dati' file, Excel files for each import mode.
test_cases.Expected Result: The system enforces import mode restrictions as specified in the 'ZENIT - Elenco Dati' file.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers validation of import modes (Manual, Integration, Both).

test_cases.Title: MassiveImporter_XPS-ZENIT-500_Requirement_FileUploadAndTemplateSelection_Desktop_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the Massive Importer section in the application.
Steps.Expected Result: Massive Importer interface is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Select a specific type of massive importer (e.g., Import RedList Data).
Steps.Expected Result: Importer type is selected and relevant options are displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Choose to download the template file for the selected importer type.
Steps.Expected Result: Template file is downloaded successfully.

Steps.Step Description: Open the template file and fill in valid data for all required fields.
Steps.Expected Result: Template file is filled with valid data.

Steps.Step Description: Upload the completed template file using the import functionality.
Steps.Expected Result: File is uploaded and accepted for processing.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1. User is authenticated and has access to the Massive Importer section. 2. The system is online and operational. 3. User has permissions to perform imports.
test_cases.Dataset: Valid template file with all required fields filled (e.g., PoS ID, Credit Line, etc.).
test_cases.Expected Result: User can successfully download the template, fill it with valid data, and upload it for processing without errors.

test_cases.Title: MassiveImporter_XPS-ZENIT-500_Requirement_StructuralValidation_Desktop_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the Massive Importer section and select an importer type.
Steps.Expected Result: Importer type is selected.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to upload a file with missing mandatory columns (e.g., missing PoS ID).
Steps.Expected Result: System rejects the file and displays an error indicating missing mandatory fields.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1. User is authenticated and has access to the Massive Importer section. 2. The system is online and operational. 3. User has permissions to perform imports.
test_cases.Dataset: Template file with one or more mandatory columns intentionally left blank or removed.
test_cases.Expected Result: System must not accept files missing mandatory fields and must provide a clear error message.

test_cases.Title: MassiveImporter_XPS-ZENIT-500_Requirement_DataValidation_Desktop_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the Massive Importer section and select an importer type.
Steps.Expected Result: Importer type is selected.

Steps.Step Description: Upload a file with invalid data in one or more fields (e.g., text in a numeric field, invalid PoS ID format).
Steps.Expected Result: System performs data validation and identifies the invalid entries.

Steps.Step Description: Review the summary of validation errors presented by the system.
Steps.Expected Result: System displays a summary indicating which rows/fields failed validation and the reason for each error.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1. User is authenticated and has access to the Massive Importer section. 2. The system is online and operational. 3. User has permissions to perform imports.
test_cases.Dataset: Template file with at least one row containing invalid data (e.g., PoS ID as 'ABC123' instead of numeric).
test_cases.Expected Result: System must reject invalid data and provide detailed error messages for each failed validation.

test_cases.Title: MassiveImporter_XPS-ZENIT-500_Requirement_SuccessfulImportAndSummary_Desktop_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the Massive Importer section and select an importer type.
Steps.Expected Result: Importer type is selected.

Steps.Step Description: Upload a valid file with correct structure and data.
Steps.Expected Result: File is accepted and processed.

Steps.Step Description: Start the massive import process.
Steps.Expected Result: System processes the file and displays a summary of the updates to be made (e.g., number of PoS to be updated).

Steps.Step Description: Confirm the import operation.
Steps.Expected Result: System completes the import and displays evidence of successful and/or unsuccessful updates.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1. User is authenticated and has access to the Massive Importer section. 2. The system is online and operational. 3. User has permissions to perform imports. 4. Valid file is prepared for upload.
test_cases.Dataset: Valid template file with multiple rows of correct data.
test_cases.Expected Result: System processes the file, updates the records, and provides a summary of successful and unsuccessful updates.

test_cases.Title: MassiveImporter_XPS-ZENIT-500_Requirement_HistorySectionAndOutputFile_Desktop_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the Massive Importer section and perform a file import (successful or with errors).
Steps.Expected Result: Import operation is completed and result is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Access the history section below the import form.
Steps.Expected Result: History section displays a list of previous imports with file names and outcome summaries.

test_cases.Expected Result: Cerved Data is successfully imported and visible for each PoS in the dashboard.

test_cases.Title: ImportCervedData-XPSZENIT540_InvalidTemplateStructure_MassiveImporter_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Expected Result: The import interface for Cerved Data is shown.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to upload an Excel file that does not conform to the required Cerved Data template structure (e.g., missing columns, extra columns, incorrect headers).

test_cases.Expected Result: System prevents import and displays a clear error message about the invalid template.

test_cases.Title: VerifyExecution_proj_001_Back-End_Procedure_TEST_Backend

Steps.Step Description: Access the back-end system with valid administrator credentials.

Steps.Expected Result: The procedure completes successfully and the system returns a success status.

test_cases.Preconditions:

2. Administrator credentials are available.
3. The procedure to be tested is deployed and accessible.
test_cases.Dataset: Valid administrator credentials; Procedure identifier or endpoint.
test_cases.Expected Result: The back-end procedure executes successfully and returns a success status.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers normal execution path for the back-end procedure.

test_cases.Title: InvalidInput_proj_001_Back-End_Procedure_TEST_Backend

Steps.Step Description: Access the back-end system with valid administrator credentials.
Steps.Expected Result: Access to the back-end system is granted.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the section for executing the back-end procedure.
Steps.Expected Result: The correct section for executing the back-end procedure is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to execute the back-end procedure with invalid or malformed input parameters.
Steps.Expected Result: The system rejects the input and displays an appropriate error message.

test_cases.Preconditions:

2. Administrator credentials are available.
3. The procedure to be tested is deployed and accessible.

test_cases.Expected Result: The system prevents execution of the procedure and returns a clear error message for invalid input.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers negative scenario for input validation.

test_cases.Title: ConcurrentExecution_proj_001_Back-End_Procedure_TEST_Backend

Steps.Step Description: Access the back-end system with valid administrator credentials from two separate sessions.
Steps.Expected Result: Both sessions are authenticated and active.

Steps.Step Description: In session one, initiate the back-end procedure.
Steps.Expected Result: The procedure starts execution in session one.

Steps.Step Description: While the procedure is still running in session one, attempt to initiate the same procedure in session two.
Steps.Expected Result: The system handles concurrent execution according to design (e.g., allows, queues, or rejects the second request with an appropriate message).

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. The back-end system is up and running.
2. Two sets of valid administrator credentials or two sessions are available.
3. The procedure to be tested is deployed and accessible.
test_cases.Dataset: Two sets of valid administrator credentials; Procedure identifier.
test_cases.Expected Result: The system handles concurrent execution attempts as per design (e.g., allows, queues, or rejects with a clear message).
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers concurrency and multi-session behavior.

test_cases.Title: AuditLog_proj_001_Back-End_Procedure_TEST_Backend

Steps.Expected Result: The procedure executes successfully.

test_cases.Title: DailyArchiving-XPSZENIT600_DailySnapshotExecution_Backend_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Ensure the system date is set to a day when the daily snapshot should run.
Steps.Expected Result: System is ready for daily snapshot execution.

Steps.Step Description: Trigger or wait for the scheduled nightly snapshot process to execute.
Steps.Expected Result: Snapshot process starts at the scheduled time.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that a new data snapshot is created and stored with the correct date and time label.
Steps.Expected Result: A new snapshot file/folder is present, labeled with the current date and time.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. System clock is synchronized and correct.
2. Daily snapshot schedule is configured and enabled.
3. Sufficient storage space is available.
test_cases.Dataset: System with historical data; snapshot schedule enabled.
test_cases.Expected Result: A daily snapshot is created and labeled with the correct date and time, confirming uninterrupted daily archiving.

test_cases.Title: DailyArchiving-XPSZENIT600_PrivacyCompliantPoSDeletion_Backend_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Identify PoS records that have been closed and inactive for more than the configured retention period (e.g., 10 years), excluding those under legal management or with recent loss transitions.
Steps.Expected Result: List of PoS eligible for deletion is generated.

Steps.Step Description: Trigger the data deletion process for eligible PoS records.
Steps.Expected Result: Deletion process executes for the identified PoS records.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that only eligible PoS records are deleted and that records under legal management or with recent loss transitions are retained.
Steps.Expected Result: Only PoS records meeting deletion criteria are removed; exceptions are preserved.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. System contains PoS records with various statuses, including closed, under legal management, and with loss transitions.
2. Retention period is configured (e.g., 10 years).
3. Data deletion process is enabled.
test_cases.Dataset: Test database with PoS records of varying statuses and closure dates.
test_cases.Expected Result: PoS records closed and inactive beyond the retention period are deleted, except those under legal management or with recent loss transitions.

test_cases.Title: DailyArchiving-XPSZENIT600_TemporaryLogicalClosureHandling_Backend_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Identify a PoS record eligible for temporary logical closure (e.g., recently closed but pending verification).
Steps.Expected Result: PoS record is selected for logical closure.

Steps.Step Description: Configure the system to apply a temporary logical closure for a defined period (e.g., 30 days).
Steps.Expected Result: Logical closure is set for the PoS record.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to display the logically closed PoS in the user interface or reporting tools.
Steps.Expected Result: PoS is not displayed to users during the logical closure period.

Steps.Step Description: After the logical closure period expires, verify that the PoS is eligible for permanent deletion.
Steps.Expected Result: PoS becomes eligible for permanent deletion after the logical closure period.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. System contains PoS records eligible for logical closure.
2. Logical closure period is configurable.
3. User interface or reporting tools are available for PoS display verification.
test_cases.Dataset: PoS records with closure dates and pending issues.
test_cases.Expected Result: PoS records under logical closure are hidden from display and become eligible for deletion after the closure period.

test_cases.Title: DailyArchiving-XPSZENIT600_ContinuousHistoricalSequenceVerification_Backend_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Access the archive of daily snapshots from the project start date to the current date.
Steps.Expected Result: Archive contains a sequence of daily snapshots.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that there are no missing days in the historical sequence of stored data.
Steps.Expected Result: Each day from project start to current date has a corresponding snapshot.

Steps.Step Description: Check that each snapshot is labeled with the correct date and time.
Steps.Expected Result: All snapshots are correctly labeled and ordered chronologically.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. System has been running and archiving data daily since project start.

test_cases.Dataset: Archive containing daily snapshots from project start to present.
test_cases.Expected Result: Historical data is complete, continuous, and correctly labeled for each day.

test_cases.Title: DailyArchiving-XPSZENIT600_ArchiveRetrievalAndAnalysis_Backend_TEST_Desktop

test_cases.Dataset: Archived data for multiple dates; access credentials for retrieval interface/API.
test_cases.Expected Result: System retrieves and displays/analyzes historical data for any given day as stored in the archive.

test_cases.Title: DailyArchiving-XPSZENIT600_ArchivingEfficiencyAndPerformance_Backend_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Initiate the daily archiving process with a large dataset (simulate high data volume).
Steps.Expected Result: Archiving process starts with large data volume.

Steps.Step Description: Measure the time taken to complete the archiving process.
Steps.Expected Result: Archiving completes within acceptable performance thresholds.

Steps.Step Description: Monitor system resource usage (CPU, memory, disk I/O) during the process.
Steps.Expected Result: Resource usage remains within acceptable limits; no system failures or slowdowns.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. System is configured for performance monitoring.
2. Large test dataset is available for archiving.
3. Performance thresholds are defined.
test_cases.Dataset: Large volume of test data; performance monitoring tools enabled.
test_cases.Expected Result: Archiving process completes efficiently and within defined performance parameters, even with large data volumes.

test_cases.Title: DailyArchiving-XPSZENIT600_ScalabilityOfHistoricalDataRetrieval_Backend_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Populate the archive with a large number of daily snapshots (simulate several years of data).
Steps.Expected Result: Archive contains a high volume of daily snapshots.

Steps.Step Description: Request retrieval of data for multiple random dates across the archive's timespan.
Steps.Expected Result: System retrieves data for each requested date without delay.

Steps.Step Description: Monitor system response time and resource usage during retrieval operations.
Steps.Expected Result: Retrieval operations complete within acceptable response times and resource usage remains stable.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. Archive is populated with a large number of daily snapshots.
2. System is configured for scalability and performance monitoring.
3. Retrieval interface/API is available.
test_cases.Dataset: Archive with several years of daily snapshots; performance monitoring tools enabled.
test_cases.Expected Result: System efficiently retrieves historical data regardless of archive size, demonstrating scalability.

test_cases.Title: DailyArchiving-XPSZENIT600_ArchiveDataCompletenessAgainstSpecification_Backend_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Compare archived data for a selected day against the specification to verify all required data points are present and archived at the correct frequency (daily, weekly, monthly).
Steps.Expected Result: Archived data matches the specification in content and frequency.

Steps.Step Description: Repeat the check for multiple days and data points as defined in the specification.
Steps.Expected Result: All required data points are consistently archived as per the specification.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. Access to 'ZENIT - Elenco Dati V04.1.xlsx'.
2. Archive contains data for the days and data points to be checked.
3. Knowledge of archiving frequencies for each data point.
test_cases.Dataset: Specification file; archived data for multiple days; mapping of data points to archiving frequency.
test_cases.Expected Result: Archived data fully complies with the external specification in terms of content and frequency.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the appendix section of the documentation.

Steps.Step Description: Click on each reference file link one by one.
Steps.Expected Result: Each link opens the corresponding file in a new browser tab or downloads the file as appropriate.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. User has access to the documentation platform.
2. User is authenticated with appropriate permissions to access the appendix section and reference files.
test_cases.Dataset: N/A
test_cases.Expected Result: Each reference file link in the appendix is accessible and opens/downloads the correct file without errors.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers only the accessibility of the reference files via provided links.

test_cases.Title: Appendix-proj_001_Requirement_Reference_Files_Correctness/Desktop_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Access each reference file via the appendix links.
Steps.Expected Result: Each file is opened or downloaded successfully.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the content of each file matches its description (e.g., the 'List of data to be predicted' file contains the expected data list, the 'Dashboard mockups' file contains dashboard mockups, etc.).
Steps.Expected Result: The content of each file matches its description and is not corrupted.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. User has access to the documentation platform and reference files.
2. User is authenticated with appropriate permissions.
3. Reference files are available and not corrupted.
test_cases.Dataset: Reference files as linked in the appendix.
test_cases.Expected Result: Each reference file contains the correct, uncorrupted content as described in the appendix.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers only the correctness and integrity of the reference file contents.

test_cases.Title: Appendix-proj_001_Requirement_Reference_Files_Permission_Negative/Desktop_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Log in as a user without permission to access the reference files.
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated with limited permissions.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the appendix section and attempt to access each reference file link.
Steps.Expected Result: Access to each reference file is denied, and an appropriate error message is displayed.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. User account exists with restricted permissions (no access to reference files).
2. Reference files are present in the appendix.
test_cases.Dataset: User credentials with restricted permissions.
test_cases.Expected Result: Users without appropriate permissions cannot access the reference files and receive a clear error message.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers negative scenario for permission handling on reference files.

test_cases.Title: Appendix-proj_001_Requirement_Reference_Files_Broken_Link_Negative/Desktop_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the appendix section of the documentation.
Steps.Expected Result: Appendix section is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Identify a reference file link that is intentionally broken or points to a non-existent file (simulate by removing or renaming the target file).
Steps.Expected Result: Broken link is present in the appendix.

Steps.Step Description: Click on the broken reference file link.
Steps.Expected Result: An error message is displayed indicating the file is not found or unavailable.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. At least one reference file link in the appendix is broken (simulate by removing or renaming the file).
2. User is authenticated with access to the appendix section.
test_cases.Dataset: N/A
test_cases.Expected Result: When a reference file link is broken, the user receives a clear error message indicating the file is unavailable.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers error handling for broken or missing reference file links.
